evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: For the reasons that follow, the court grants the ex parte application for release from custody.

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED that petitioner Osorto’s ex parte application for release (docket no. 111) is GRANTED.

extracted.value: Granted ex parte application for release from immigration custody (Petitioner: Carlos Osorto) on July 30, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: The immigration court denied the parties’ renewed motions for a bond hearing on the grounds that DHS failed to allege any new facts or explain how the immigration court would have jurisdiction.

extracted.value: Denied parties’ renewed motions for a bond hearing on July 23, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: The court orders that petitioner be released from custody upon posting of a $5,000 bond, and with the condition that he be placed on location monitoring with an ankle monitor.

extracted.value: Ordered petitioner to be released on bond with a $5,000 posting and ankle monitor, effective July 30, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: The court ordered the parties to provide further briefing in light of the immigration court’s July 23, 2025 denial of the renewed motion for a bond hearing, which they did. Docket nos. 125, 126.

extracted.value: Ordered parties to provide further briefing following the denial of the renewed bond motion on July 23, 2025.

evidence.text: the district court issued the requested TRO on July 11.

extracted.value: Issued a temporary restraining order (TRO) on July 11, 2025.

evidence.text: we deny Defendants’ motion for a stay except as to a single clause.

extracted.value: Denied defendants’ motion for a stay except as to a single clause.

evidence.text: the district court ordered that Osorto be released on bond on July 30, 2025.

extracted.value: Ordered that Osorto be released on bond on July 30, 2025.

evidence.text: ORDER GRANTING JOINT STIPULATION FOR WITHDRAWAL OF PETITIONERS' EX PARTE APPLICATION FOR TEMPORARY RESTRAINING ORDER AND ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE RE: PRELIMINARY INJUNCTION 9 by Judge Maame Ewusi-Mensah Frimpong.

extracted.value: ORDER GRANTING JOINT STIPULATION FOR WITHDRAWAL OF PETITIONERS' EX PARTE APPLICATION FOR TEMPORARY RESTRAINING ORDER AND ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE RE: PRELIMINARY INJUNCTION 9 by Judge Maame Ewusi-Mensah Frimpong.

evidence.text: The Court is in receipt of Plaintiffs' second Ex Parte Application for Temporary Restraining order and Order to Show Cause Regarding Preliminary Injunction. ECF No. 45 . The parties are ordered to fully brief the second Ex Parte Application in compliance with the briefing schedule outlined in the Courts Order in ECF No. 42 . The Court sets a hearing on both of Plaintiffs Ex Parte Applications (ECF Nos. 38, 45 ) on Thursday, July 10, 2025, at the new time of 1:00 pm.

extracted.value: ORDER to fully brief second Ex Parte Application for Temporary Restraining Order and Order to Show Cause Regarding Preliminary Injunction (Judge Maame Ewusi-Mensah Frimpong).

evidence.text: ORDERS that Intervenors shall be permitted to participate in the July 10 TRO Hearing.

extracted.value: ORDERS that Intervenors shall be permitted to participate in the July 10 TRO Hearing.

evidence.text: DENIED the Stay Ex Parte Application.

evidence.text: The Court ORDERS the following briefing schedule and hearing date for the Motion for Preliminary Injunction and Order to Show Cause hearing. Preliminary Hearing Motion: Monday, July 28, 2025; Opposition: Monday, August 25, 2025; Reply: Monday, September 8, 2025; Hearing: Wednesday, September 24, 2025, at 9:00 a.m.
